column4: anybody know how can I record stuff in ubuntu? neither audacity or sound recorder works
have you selected the mic for recording (toggled it with the spacebar in alsamixer/F4 and unmuted it 'm')?
what is System> Preferences> Multimedia Systems Selector> Default audio source set to?
does setting it to esd or oss resolve that issue?
you should be able to test System> Preferences> Multimedia Systems Selector> Default audio source> esd/oss [Test]
set it to oss, then use audacity to record something
System> Preferences> Sound> disable sound server startup
and make sure you close all other open sound apps
generally, no, but for audacity, yes
have you tried arecord directly from the cli?
there are lots of possible reasons; have you checked Malone?
and no, you shouldn't be forced to stop esd
perhaps you can test with flight 5 tomorrow
it's the very basic ALSA recording tool. Yes.
okay, thanks for all the help
